name: Purgatory, Inc.
description:
Update: I fixed the resolution of the screen, so now everything should be displayed properly. Please don't play this game in fullscreen if your screen's aspect ratio isn't 16:9.

A submission to Mini Jam 69, with the theme of "Hell" and the limitation "Cards must be a mechanic."

For millennia, the esteemed Purgatory, Inc. has been choosing to send people to heaven or hell, but with the advent of overpopulation, it’s becoming too inefficient to judge them by reading out their good/bad deeds. So the CEO settled on a simpler method: take the first three cards drawn from a deck, add them up and if the sum is even, they go to heaven, else they go to hell. Your job, as the new customs officer, is to decide whether people go to heaven or to hell for five grueling days.

Controls: Click the check boxes, either heaven or hell depending on the sum of the cards, to send the ticket off. If you check off the wrong box, you lose a life. You have 15 lives across the five days, so don't fail too early on...
